name: B. Indivisible
statement:
You’re given a positive integer n.Find a permutation a_1, a_2,
dots, a_n such that for any 1
leq l < r
leq n, the sum a_l + a_{l+1} +
dots + a_r is not divisible by r-l+1.A permutation of length n is an
array consisting of n distinct integers from 1 to n in arbitrary order.
For example, [2,3,1,5,4] is a permutation, but [1,2,2] is not a
permutation (2 appears twice in the array), and [1,3,4] is also not a
permutation (n=3 but there is 4 in the array).
editorial:
If is odd, there is no solution, as the sum of the whole array is always
divisible by . Otherwise, the solution is as follows: Start with the
identity permutation . Swap the adjacent pairs to get . Indeed, consider
the sum of a sub-array . There are cases: and have different parity: the
sum is and its greatest common divisor with is , as is not divisible by
; and have the same parity: the sum is or , depending on the parity. The
first summand is divisible by , as is even. So, the whole sum has the
remainder or modulo , thus it canât be divisible by it.
